contentrichtext.text: [[File:Pantanal, south-central South America 5170.jpg|thumb|300px|The [[Pantanal]], in south-central [[South America]].]] '''Flooded grasslands and savannas''' is a terrestrial [[biome]]. Its component [[ecoregion]]s are generally located at [[subtropical]] and [[tropical]] [[latitude]]s, which are [[flood]]ed seasonally or year-round. The common name often used is [[swamp]]. ==Characteristics== Flooded grasslands and savanna [[habitat]]s, [[plant community|plant communities]], [[ecosystem]]s, [[ecozone]]s, and ecoregions are characterized by: *very wet to saturated soil moisture content in nutrient rich soils. *in temperate—warm to tropical—hot climates. They are found as [[grassland]]s, [[savanna]]s, and [[wetland]]s. ===Examples=== ;Some type examples include: <div style="column-count:2;-moz-column-count:2;-webkit-column-count:2"> * [[Bog]] * [[Coniferous swamp]] * [[Dambo]] * [[Fen]] * [[Flood-meadow]] * [[Freshwater swamp forest]] * [[Hydrogen sulfide]] * [[Mangrove]]s * [[Marsh]] * [[Marsh gas]] * [[Muck (soil)]] * [[Peat]] * [[Peat swamp forest]] * [[Salt marsh]] * [[Shrub swamp]] * [[Water-meadow]] * [[Wet meadow]] </div> ==See also== *[[:Category:Flooded grasslands and savannas|Index: Flooded grasslands and savannas]] - ''for location examples and descriptions.'' ==External links== {{commons category|Flooded grasslands and savannas}} *[http://www.panda.org/about_wwf/where_we_work/ecoregions/about/habitat_types/selecting_terrestrial_ecoregions/habitat09.cfm Panda.org: More about the '''Flooded grasslands and savannas''' biome] {{-}} {{Wetlands}} {{Biomes}} {{-}} [[Category:Flooded grasslands and savannas| ]] [[Category:Grasslands]] [[Category:Wetlands]] [[Category:Terrestrial biomes]] {{ecology-stub}}
